intro: Ballota deserti, commonly known as the desert ballota, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Ballota deserti is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing on rocky soils and in open habitats. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain desert wildlife.
